translated: Six-Syllable Divine Mantra Sutra

original: 南天竺國三藏菩提流志奉　詔譯
analyzed: 南天竺國三藏菩提流志奉　詔譯
translated: Translated by Tripiṭaka Master Bodhiruci of South India, under Imperial Edict
Oṃ bhagavān

original: 此文殊師利六字呪功能我今欲說。
analyzed: 此文殊師利六字呪功能我今欲說。
translated: The function of this six-syllable mantra of Mañjuśrī, I will now explain.
If there are those who wish to accomplish this mantra,
Either eat milk porridge or eat vegetables.
Or eat fruit and drink milk.

original: 應食此食日別三時洗浴。
analyzed: 應食此食日別三時洗浴。
translated: You should eat this food and bathe three times a day.
The time after five o'clock in the morning is the first time.
The time after noon is the second time.

original: 黃昏已後至初夜為第三時。
analyzed: 黃昏已後至初夜為第三時。
translated: The time after dusk until the first part of the night is the third time.
During these three times, bathe once each time.
Wear a set of clean clothes separately each time.
Therefore, you also need three sets of clean clothes.
Recite the mantra until it reaches 600,000 times.

original: 此為最初承事供養文殊。
analyzed: 此為最初承事供養文殊。
translated: This is the initial service and offering to Mañjuśrī.
Moreover, if you wish to uphold and accomplish it,
You must first paint an image of Mañjuśrī.
The method of painting the image.
Take good white felt without hair.
Also, do not cut the warp and weft.
Do not use glue for the colors.
Mix with fragrant juice when painting.
The image of Mañjuśrī
is seated in full lotus posture on a lotus seat.
The right hand forms the mudrā of expounding the Dharma.
The left hand is placed in the lap facing upwards.
The body of the image is in the form of a youth.
The color of the body is golden.
Celestial garments are white, covering below the navel.
The rest of the body is exposed.

original: 首戴天冠身珮瓔珞臂印釧等。
analyzed: 首戴天冠身珮瓔珞臂印釧等。
translated: The head is adorned with a celestial crown, and the body is adorned with pendants, necklaces, arm ornaments, and bracelets.
Adorned with various things.
On the left side, paint the image of Avalokiteśvara.
The body is the color of white silver.
Adorned with necklaces and garments as usual.
Seated in full lotus posture on a lotus flower.
The right hand holds a white whisk.
On the right side, paint the image of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva.
The body is the color of gold.
Adorned with necklaces as usual.

original: 亦坐蓮華座右手執白拂。
analyzed: 亦坐蓮華座右手執白拂。
translated: Also sitting on a lotus seat, holding a white whisk in the right hand.
Above Mañjuśrī, in the sky on both sides,
each one should be painted as a Dhāraṇī Heaven.
Holding a garland in the hand.
Only half the body is visible in the clouds in the sky.
The hand hangs down a garland.
Below the image of Mañjuśrī, on the right side,
paint the one who upholds the mantra.
The right knee touches the ground, holding an incense burner in the hand.

original: 其文殊師利等所坐華下遍畫作池水。
analyzed: 其文殊師利等所坐華下遍畫作池水。
translated: Under the flowers where Mañjuśrī and the others are sitting, paint a pond everywhere.
On both sides of the bodhisattva images,
each one is painted on a mountain peak.

original: 其畫師從起首欲畫之時。
analyzed: 其畫師從起首欲畫之時。
translated: When the painter begins to paint,
he should observe the eight precepts each day,
bathe, put on clean clothes, and paint.
Until the painting is finished.

original: 若有舍利塔即安文殊像。
analyzed: 若有舍利塔即安文殊像。
translated: If there is a stūpa with relics, place the image of Mañjuśrī
facing west on the west side of the stūpa.
If there is no large stūpa, a small stūpa should be placed
in front of the image of Mañjuśrī, facing west.

original: 設種種華種種飲食果子等。
analyzed: 設種種華種種飲食果子等。
translated: Set out various flowers, various food and drink, fruits, and so on.
Make offerings three times [a day].
In the ritual arena, burn butter lamps.
The ritual arena must be in a quiet place.
Only allow one person to provide service.
If you are in the ritual arena reciting the mantra,

original: 所須華香等彈指而索不得出言。
analyzed: 所須華香等彈指而索不得出言。
translated: When you need flowers, incense, and so on, snap your fingers to request them, do not speak out loud.
Take agarwood, cut it to be two fingers long,

original: 都盧婆香油蘇合香稀者是無烟佉陀羅木炭。
analyzed: 都盧婆香油蘇合香稀者是無烟佉陀羅木炭。
translated: Dhupa incense, sesame oil, and olibanum incense, the sparse ones are smokeless. Khadira charcoal.
If there is none,
Substitute with purple sandalwood.
Also, put agarwood inside the oil mentioned above.

original: 於像前佉羅木炭火中燒盡一夜。
analyzed: 於像前佉羅木炭火中燒盡一夜。
translated: In front of the image, in the khadira charcoal fire, burn it all up overnight.
Until the appearance of dawn,
Then you will see Mañjuśrī.
All your wishes will be fulfilled.
Except for matters of sexual desire.
Other than that, you will not go against your requests.
Also, in front of the image,
Take sandalwood, cut it to be two fingers long,
Burning offerings day and night.

original: 是時文殊師利即現身當為說法。
analyzed: 是時文殊師利即現身當為說法。
translated: At that time, Mañjuśrī will manifest his body and expound the Dharma for them.
All physical ailments will be completely cured.
One will attain the stage of a bodhisattva and mastery.
Moreover, in front of the image,
smear the ground with cow dung.
Scatter various famous flowers.

original: 行者於塗地場內一邊坐。
analyzed: 行者於塗地場內一邊坐。
translated: The practitioner sits on one side inside the smeared ground area.
Recite the mantra to completion, 108 times.

original: 經一月得聰明持一切經論。
analyzed: 經一月得聰明持一切經論。
translated: After one month, one will become intelligent and memorize all sutras and treatises.

original: 又法日日隨心常誦莫忘。
analyzed: 又法日日隨心常誦莫忘。
translated: Moreover, recite it daily as much as one wishes, never forgetting.
One will definitely receive the retribution for one's karma and cause it to be extinguished.

original: 又法若日別能誦滿一百八遍。
analyzed: 又法若日別能誦滿一百八遍。
translated: Moreover, if one can recite it 108 times every day,

original: 臨命終時得見文殊師利。
analyzed: 臨命終時得見文殊師利。
translated: at the time of death, one will see Mañjuśrī.
One will be able to be reborn according to one's wishes.

original: 文殊師利為利益眾生故。
analyzed: 文殊師利為利益眾生故。
translated: Mañjuśrī, for the benefit of sentient beings,
briefly explained a few of the abilities.

original: 六字神呪經宋藏此函更有六字神呪王經菩提流志譯者。

translated: there is a Six-Syllable Divine Spell Sutra translated by Bodhiruci.

Examining it, this sutra is exactly that.

analyzed: 即是知函中失譯人名今付梁錄者耳。
translated: it is the one with the translator's name lost in the Zhi case, now attributed to the Liang Catalog.

translated: The Song canon sees the name Six-Syllable Divine Spell in its title,

original: 遂濫同焉重編於此才函之中。
analyzed: 遂濫同焉重編於此才函之中。
translated: and thus mistakenly includes it in this Cai case.
This is one mistake.

original: 而又妄安流志之名何耶。
